response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
if(it.next() instanceof MyClass){
names.add(((MyClass)it.next()).getValue(String.class));
}else{
break;
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can check if the next element in the iterator satisfies your predicate and add it to the list if it does. If not, you can break out of the loop. This way, you don't need to use try/catch blocks or throw exceptions.
